application.name: csminit
application.brief: Attach a CSM model state to a cube.

description.p: This program takes an ISD and attempts to create a valid CSM model from the loaded CSM Libraries. If a single model can be created, its state string is attached to the cube in the CSMState BLOB for later use. If there are multiple valid CSM Models that can be instantiated, then this program will error and return a list of possible models. The user will then have to re-run it using the PLUGINNAME and/or MODELNAME parameters to select a specific model.
Various pieces of information about the CSM model will also be added to the CsmInfo group on the cube label. These are just for users to reference and are not used programmatically.
This program can be run on any Cube file, but if the Cube has spice data from spiceinit then it will be removed so that there is no ambiguity between the ISIS and CSM model.
See the Plugins group in the IsisPreferences file for information about how to load CSM Libraries for use with this and other ISIS applications.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.brief: The input cube that the state string will be attached to.
parameter.description: The input cube that the state string will be attached to. Any kernels specified in the kernels group and any attached SPICE tables will be removed when the model state is attached.

parameter.name: ISD
parameter.brief: The ISD file that will be used.
parameter.description: The ISD file that will be used to create the model state string. The ISD can be just a filename ISD or a NITF2.1 ISD.

parameter.name: TARGETNAME
parameter.brief: The name of the body observed by the image.
parameter.description: The name of the body observed by the image. If not entered, then the target already listed on the label will be used.

parameter.name: SHAPEMODEL
parameter.brief: The shapemodel to represent the surface of the observed body.
parameter.description: The shapemodel to represent the surface of the observed body. If none is entered, then a bi-axial ellipsoid is used. The radii are defined by the CSM model.

parameter.name: PLUGINNAME
parameter.brief: The name of the plugin to use.
parameter.description: The name of the plugin to use. The loaded CSM Libraries will be searched for a plugin that has this name. If no such plugin is found an error will be returned.

parameter.name: MODELNAME
parameter.brief: The name of the model to use.
parameter.description: The name of the model to use. The loaded CSM Libraries will be searched for a model that has this name. If no such model is found an error will be returned.
